title: New Terraform integrations with Dell, DNSimple, Fortinet, Palo Alto Networks, Juniper Networks, and more
content:
As our HashiCorp Terraform ecosystem continues to expand, we welcome new integrations that provide additional capabilities to Terraform Cloud, Enterprise, and Community edition users as they deploy and manage their cloud and on-premises infrastructure. Terraform is the world’s most widely used multi-cloud provisioning product. Whether you're deploying to Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, other clouds, or an on-premises datacenter, Terraform can be a single control plane, using infrastructure as code for infrastructure automation to provision and manage your entire infrastructure.

Terraform Cloud

HashiCorp announces a new Terraform Cloud integration:

DNSimple

DNSimple delivers simple and secure automation for domain registration, primary DNS hosting, and SSL certificates. Its new Terraform Cloud integration provides prescriptive Sentinel policies for establishing secure Terraform configurations for domains and DNS in DNSimple.

Terraform providers

We also have 17 new verified Terraform providers from our partners:

Airbyte

Airbyte is an open source data integration engine that helps you consolidate your data in your data warehouses, lakes, and databases. The Airbyte Terraform provider integration provides a Terraform module for setting up BigQuery Destination with Airbyte.

Cisco Systems

Cisco delivers software-defined networking, cloud, and security solutions to help transform your business. The new Cisco Defense Orchestrator (CDO) provider is now available to onboard and manage the many devices and other resources supported by CDO.

ClickHouse

ClickHouse is a column-oriented SQL database management system (DBMS) for online analytical processing (OLAP). The new ClickHouse Terraform provider integration is now available to deploy on any environment.

Cloudera

Cloudera offers cloud-native analytics for data distribution, data engineering, data warehousing, transactional data, streaming data, data science, and machine learning. Its new Cloudera Terraform provider integration for AWS partner solution allows you to deploy a Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) in the AWS Cloud.

Dell

Dell, a global company that designs, develops, and manufactures PCs and a variety of computer-related products, has contributed two new Terraform integrations. The Terraform provider for Dell Technologies (Dell) PowerScale allows datacenter and IT administrators to use Terraform to automate and orchestrate the provisioning and management of Dell PowerScale storage systems. The Terraform provider for RedFish lets datacenter and IT administrators use Terraform to automate and orchestrate the provisioning and management of PowerEdge servers.

Fortinet

Fortinet, a global cybersecurity company, launched a new Terraform provider for Fortiswitch, which manages switches to deliver the intelligent scalability you need to keep your growing business, school, or branch office moving with minimal oversight.

Juniper Networks

Juniper Networks is a global provider of AI networking, cloud, and connected security solutions. The Terraform provider integration for Apstra automates Juniper’s intent-based networking software.

Kestra Technologies

Kestra Technologies is a wearable medical device and digital healthcare company that protects patients with diagnostic and therapeutic technologies. The new Kestra Terraform provider defines Kestra resources so that they can be deployed using infrastructure as code with Terraform.

Materialize

Materialize is a streaming database purpose-built for low-latency applications. Its Materialize Terraform provider integration enables resource code management with Terraform.

Orca Security

Orca Security detects, prioritizes, and continuously monitors for common and obscure identity and access management (IAM) misconfigurations across your public cloud to meet stringent IAM compliance mandates and improve your cloud security posture. The Orca Security Terraform provider enables the management of your Orca resources with Terraform.

Palo Alto Networks

Palo Alto Networks is a leading multi-cloud security company. The Terraform provider for Palo Alto Networks Prisma Cloud web application and API security (WAAS) allows for the management of WAAS policies. This provider was created using the Terraform plugin framework and can be used as a standalone provider.

Panther Labs

A modern SIEM built for the cloud, Panther Lab's mission is to make security monitoring fast, flexible, and scalable for all security teams. The Panther Labs Terraform provider allows customers to manage their various log providers.

Prefect

Prefect is a workflow orchestration tool empowering developers to build, observe, and react to data pipelines. The Terraform provider for Prefect allows the user to seamlessly stand up their Prefect workflows.

Sym

Sym is a security workflow platform that solves the intent-to-execution gap between policies and workflows. The Sym Terraform provider is a runtime-connector module to provision an IAM role that a Sym Runtime uses to execute a Flow.

Timeplus

Timeplus is a unified platform for streaming and historical data. With the Timeplus Terraform provider, Timeplus customers at any scale can safely accelerate data streaming initiatives in the cloud (public, private, or hybrid) with infrastructure management that is fully automated through code and integrated within continuous delivery workflows.

Vantage

Vantage gives developers the tools they need to analyze, report on, and reduce AWS costs. The Vantage Terraform provider contains Terraform modules for integrating AWS with Vantage.

Versa Networks

Versa Networks provides an end-to-end solution that both simplifies and secures the WAN/branch office network. The Terraform provider for Versa Networks Director is a plugin for Terraform that allows you to interact with the Versa Networks platform.

Learn more about Terraform integrations

All integrations are available for review in our HashiCorp Terraform Registry. To verify an existing integration, please refer to our Terraform Cloud Integration Program.

If you haven’t already, try the free tier of Terraform Cloud to help simplify your Terraform workflows and management.
author: Nicole Bahr
